verses.verse: David<WH1732> was told,<WH5046> "Behold,<WH6430> the Philistines are fighting<WH3898> against Keilah,<WH7084> and are robbing<WH8154> the threshing floors.<WH1637>"

Therefore David<WH1732> inquired<WH7592> of Yahweh,<WH3068> saying,<WH559> "Shall I go<WH3212> and strike<WH5221> these Philistines?<WH6430>" Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "Go<WH3212> strike<WH5221> the Philistines,<WH6430> and save<WH3467> Keilah.<WH7084>"

David<WH1732>'s men<WH582> said<WH559> to him,<WH3373> "Behold, we are afraid here in Judah:<WH3063> how much more then if we go<WH3212> to Keilah<WH7084> against the armies<WH4634> of the Philistines?<WH6430>"

Then David<WH1732> inquired<WH7592> of Yahweh<WH3068> yet again.<WH3254> Yahweh<WH3068> answered<WH6030> him,<WH6030> and said, "Arise,<WH6965> go down<WH3381> to Keilah;<WH7084> for I will deliver<WH5414> the Philistines<WH6430> into your hand.<WH3027>"

David<WH1732> and his men<WH582> went<WH3212> to Keilah,<WH7084> and fought<WH3898> with the Philistines,<WH6430> and brought away<WH5090> their livestock,<WH4735> and killed<WH5221> them with a great<WH1419> slaughter.<WH4347> So David<WH1732> saved<WH3467> the inhabitants<WH3427> of Keilah.<WH7084>
It happened,<WH54> when Abiathar the son<WH1121> of Ahimelech<WH288> fled<WH1272> to David<WH1732> to Keilah,<WH7084> that he came down<WH3381> with an ephod<WH646> in his hand.<WH3027>

It was told<WH5046> Saul<WH7586> that David<WH1732> had come<WH935> to Keilah.<WH7084> Saul<WH7586> said,<WH559> "God<WH430> has delivered<WH5234> him into my hand;<WH3027> for he is shut in,<WH5462> by entering<WH935> into a town<WH5892> that has gates<WH1817> and bars.<WH1280>"
Saul<WH7586> summoned<WH8085> all the people<WH5971> to<WH8085> war,<WH4421> to go down<WH3381> to Keilah,<WH7084> to besiege<WH6696> David<WH1732> and his men.<WH582>
David<WH1732> knew<WH3045> that Saul<WH7586> was devising<WH2790> mischief<WH7451> against him;<WH559> and he said to Abiathar<WH54> the priest,<WH3548> "Bring the ephod<WH646> here.<WH5066>"

Then David<WH1732> said,<WH559> "O Yahweh,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> your servant<WH5650> has surely<WH8085> heard<WH8085> that Saul<WH7586> seeks<WH1245> to come<WH935> to Keilah,<WH7084> to destroy<WH7843> the city for my sake.<WH5892>

Will the men<WH1167> of Keilah<WH7084> deliver me up<WH5462> into his hand?<WH3027> Will Saul<WH7586> come down,<WH3381> as your servant<WH5650> has heard?<WH8085> Yahweh,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> I beg you,<WH5046> tell your servant.<WH5650>" Yahweh<WH3068> said,<WH559> "He will come down.<WH3381>"

Then David<WH1732> said,<WH559> "Will the men<WH1167> of Keilah<WH7084> deliver<WH5462> me and my men<WH582> into the hand<WH3027> of Saul?<WH7586>" Yahweh<WH3068> said,<WH559> "They will deliver you up.<WH5462>"

Then David<WH1732> and his men,<WH582> who were about six<WH8337> hundred,<WH3967> arose<WH6965> and departed<WH3318> out of Keilah,<WH7084> and went<WH1980> wherever<WH834> they could go.<WH1980> It was told<WH5046> Saul<WH7586> that David<WH1732> was escaped<WH4422> from Keilah;<WH7084> and he gave<WH2308> up going there.<WH3318>

David<WH1732> stayed<WH3427> in the wilderness<WH4057> in the strongholds,<WH4679> and remained<WH3427> in the hill<WH2022> country in the wilderness<WH4057> of Ziph.<WH2128> Saul<WH7586> sought<WH1245> him every day,<WH3117> but God<WH430> didn't<WH5414> deliver him into his hand.<WH3027>
David<WH1732> saw<WH7200> that Saul<WH7586> had come out<WH3318> to seek<WH1245> his life.<WH5315> David<WH1732> was in the wilderness<WH4057> of Ziph<WH2128> in the wood.<WH2793>
Jonathan,<WH3083> Saul<WH7586>'s son,<WH1121> arose,<WH6965> and went<WH3212> to David<WH1732> into the woods,<WH2793> and strengthened<WH2388> his hand<WH3027> in God.<WH430>

He said<WH559> to him,<WH3372> "Don't be afraid; for the hand<WH3027> of Saul<WH7586> my father<WH1> shall not find<WH4672> you;<WH4427> and you shall be king over Israel,<WH3478> and I shall be next<WH4932> to you;<WH7586> and that also Saul my father<WH1> knows.<WH3045>"
They both<WH8147> made<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> before<WH6440> Yahweh:<WH3068> and David<WH1732> stayed<WH3427> in the woods,<WH2793> and Jonathan<WH3083> went<WH1980> to his house.<WH1004>

Then the Ziphites<WH2130> came up<WH5927> to Saul<WH7586> to Gibeah,<WH1390> saying,<WH559> "Doesn't<WH1732> David hide<WH5641> himself with us in the strongholds<WH4679> in the wood,<WH2793> in the hill<WH1389> of Hachilah,<WH2444> which is on the south<WH3225> of the desert?<WH3452>

Now therefore,<WH4428> O king, come down,<WH3381> according to all the desire<WH185> of your soul<WH5315> to come down;<WH3381> and our part shall be to deliver<WH5462> him up into the king<WH4428>'s hand.<WH3027>"
Saul<WH7586> said,<WH559> "You are blessed<WH1288> by Yahweh;<WH3068> for you have had compassion on me.<WH2550>

Please go<WH3212> make<WH3559> yet more sure,<WH3045> and know and see<WH7200> his place<WH4725> where his haunt<WH7272> is,<WH7200> and who has seen him there;<WH559> for it is told me that he deals very<WH6191> subtly.<WH6191>

See<WH7200> therefore,<WH3045> and take knowledge of all the lurking places<WH4224> where he hides<WH2244> himself,<WH7725> and come again to me with certainty,<WH3559> and I will go<WH1980> with you:<WH3426> and it shall happen, if he is in the land,<WH776> that I will search<WH2664> him out among all the thousands<WH505> of Judah.<WH3063>"

They arose,<WH6965> and went<WH3212> to Ziph<WH2128> before<WH6440> Saul:<WH7586> but David<WH1732> and his men<WH582> were in the wilderness<WH4057> of Maon,<WH4584> in the Arabah<WH6160> on the south<WH3225> of the desert.<WH3452>

Saul<WH7586> and his men<WH582> went<WH3212> to seek<WH1245> him.<WH1732> When David was told,<WH5046> he went down<WH3381> to the rock,<WH5553> and stayed<WH3427> in the wilderness<WH4057> of Maon.<WH4584> When Saul<WH7586> heard<WH8085> that,<WH7291> he pursued <WH310> David<WH1732> in the wilderness<WH4057> of Maon.<WH4584>

Saul<WH7586> went<WH3212> on this side<WH6654> of the mountain,<WH2022> and David<WH1732> and his men<WH582> on that side<WH6654> of the mountain:<WH2022> and David<WH1732> made haste<WH2648> to get away<WH3212> for fear<WH6440> of Saul;<WH7586> for Saul<WH7586> and his men<WH582> surrounded<WH5849> David<WH1732> and his men<WH582> to<WH5849> take them.<WH8610>
But a messenger<WH4397> came<WH935> to Saul,<WH7586> saying,<WH559> "Hurry<WH4116> and come;<WH3212> for the Philistines<WH6430> have made a raid<WH6584> on the land!<WH776>"

So Saul<WH7586> returned<WH7725> from pursuing<WH7291> after<WH310> David,<WH1732> and went<WH3212> against<WH7125> the Philistines:<WH6430> therefore they called<WH7121> that place<WH4725> Sela Hammahlekoth.<WH5555>
David<WH1732> went up<WH5927> from there,<WH3427> and lived in the strongholds<WH4679> of En Gedi.<WH5872>
